FuncDef: The test connectivity controller e1 command enables the system to test the bit error rate of an E1 interface.
CLIs: test connectivity controller e1 <controller-number> { unframed | channelized timeslot-list <slot-list> } duration <time>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of an E1 interface.
-

Indicates that the E1 interface works in unframed mode.
-

Indicates that the E1 interface works in channelized mode.
-

Specifies the number or the range of the timeslots to be bundled.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 31. You can specify either a single timeslot or a range of timeslots. A comma (,) is used to separate timeslots, and a hyphen (-) is used to specify a timeslot range.

Specifies the bit error rate test duration for an E1 interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 10, in seconds.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] test connectivity controller e1 1/0/0 unframed duration 3
Warning: The traffic on this interface will be interrupted if the operation is p
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When faults occur on an E1 interface, you can run the test connectivity controller e1 command to test the bit error rate of the E1 interface.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The working mode specified in the command must be the same as the configuration of the E1 interface.
